Reviews.Title: “recommendable”
Reviews.Author: yi g
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights stay in this hotel. At second night, we was informed that the room is not yet ready, but the staff of reception has arranged another good hotel for us. Raymond locate at tram station nearly,and walk to Blue mosque,Hagia Sophia less than 10 minutes. The staff of hotel is very friendly, smile on the face always, and help us to buy tickets of bus to Goreme. We feel very good in Raymond hotel. Recommend to stay here if you trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Al_yesiller
Reviews.Content: Hotel raymond was one of the most beautiful hotels I've stayed at though small like every other hotel in the area the rooms were very clean and the staff was very professional Murat at the front dest was my sons (Aydin) favorite and erdel, borkem,capan,nurullah,basin,metin,arzu and the general manager that has a very nice chrysler 300 were awesome and made us feel like we were home! i would recommend this hotel to everyone it is well worth every dollar ! the breakfast was more than we expected and the price was free for breakfast and great prices for afternoon menu . the hotel is located about 5 minutes away from topkapi and about minutes away from aga sophia walking distance . Alpaslan Yesiller room 206 4/1-4/5 2012,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Good starting point to discover Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Kriszta_HU
Reviews.Content: I can only recommend Raymond Hotel. The staffs are very kind and helpful, the rooms are beautiful (a little bit small, but you won't spend there too much time, because there are so much fun in Istanbul), and the location of the hotel is ideal for short sightseeing, Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Aya Sophia are very close to it (5-10 minutes walk). Dear staff! Thanks for everything, when we go back to Istanbul, we will go back to Raymond for sure. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good all round value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tina B
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after spending 3 nights in this hotel. Yes, the rooms are small but it was large enough to accommodate a king size bed with good quality bed linen. Yes,the bathroom was also small but the shower was good and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was typicial Turkish and consisted of a variety of cold meats, cheeses, olives, salad, dried and fresh fruit, breads cakes, eggs and chips. The coffee was delicious. The staff were lovely, they were very welcoming and always had a smile for us and they organised our transfer back to the airport. The location was excellent, just a few minutes walk from the main tourist attractions and lots of restaurants in the local vacinity. Considering the price we paid, we thought it represented excellent value for money and recommend it for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: rgf2004
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general is good hotel because of the following: â€¢ Perfect location near to all of the interested places â€¢ friendly staff and nice breakfast and restaurant â€¢ cleaning of the room sounds to be good The only problem that I faced in this hotel that it's rooms is very small in a way that makes me dislike the stay in the hotel. Aah the second problem which may be not a problem was the TV as it doesn't have alot of Arabic or English channels, Turkish channels are the majority.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Raymond hotel for 4 nights in February 2012 and I can happily recommend this hotel for other travellers! Location is perfect, in the heart of the beautiful Istanbul. My room was comfortable and tidy, actually better than I expected :) I actually got a double room allthough I was travelling alone. Breakfast was good and the staff very helpful and friendly, thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Elshan R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my wife and 5 months baby. The location is excellent with some minutes walking distance to the most attractive sites of Istanbul including Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagie Sophia, Mahmutpasha, Kapalicharshi (Grand Bazaar) and etc. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast also was very tasty. I recommend everyone to stay at this hotel. We enjoyed our holiday in Istanbul at Raymond Hotel. I will excatly choose this hotel for my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: Rusty78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in during Christmas break. There were 4 of us and had requested for 2 doubles. however, we got 1 room on 2nd floor and the other on 6th floor, the worst part being the lift which goes only upto 5th floor, and you have to climb some very uncomfortable stairs to reach 6th floor, where rooms have a slant roof. So i would suggest an absolute NO to rooms on 6th floor. When I highlighted this to the front desk, was told that hotel is full and they cant do anything about this for that night, but will shift us to 3rd floor the next day. In given circumstances, I didnt mind that. Negatives - Lift: very funny, cant take more than 4 ( and I mean exact 4). Service :- very slow. The room would never have enough tea bags ( and there is no coffee available). We had to ask for tea bags everyday. English skills of staff didn't help the cause. So the most efficient way was to go down to the restaurant and fetch for yourself. on last day we checked out at 7 , but couldn't get any breakfast as the restaurant was not ready in time. So we had to skip! Extremely slow staff and hardly speak or understand English Rooms : Very small size, 100s of channels, but just a couple in English. No view. Breakfast: basic and limited spread. Now Positives: - Very good location close to everything - Topkapi, blue mosque, Harbour, Grand and spice bazaar, tram station , good restaurants close by. - Despite the lack of reasonable english skills, the staff seemed pleasant and always willing to help ( as much as they could)

Reviews.Title: “Hardly recommendable!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Natalia N
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Very friendly staff, warm hospitality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Rui1154791
Reviews.Content: Don't look any further, Excellent location within walking distance from main attractions. The staff was very kind. The breakfast was very good and the dinner fantastic for a very reasonable price. I'd like to thank to Mr Metin and Mr Yasin for their excellent support and readiness in the restaurant. I'm sure I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rubi r
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by the lovely staff and their helpfulness and politeness. The rooms although cosy were very clean and the housekeeping was very good. I really enjoyed my stay..(wish they:d had conditioner as well as shampoo though). Location was perfect...within walking distance of most locations and taxis and trams were very reasonably priced. Breakfast and the service was good as was the evening meal if you wanted to eat at the hotel. I really liked the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - very friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Himanshu G
Reviews.Content: Raymond Hotel is in a very good location. Several locations are at walking distance. Harbour, train station, restaurants, blue mosque etc... I am a frequent traveler, but did not bother to rate hotels till today. But this time, because of warm hospitality, friendlyness and politeness of entire staff, (without an exception) I am kind of compelled to do so. Room I got was on 5th floor, very quite from out side no sound would come in. Room was relatively cozy but very clean. Good king size bed was comfortable. Specially restaurant staff would kind of take care of every thing, even took care of a small baby with baloons while parents were eating. Excelent service. Breakfast was good, with warm part changing every day. In a nut shell, good worth for every thing. Thanks to the staff and also those who recommended this hotel to us.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Tudor1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raymond Hotel for 5 days. Very helpful staff, hotel very clean, breakfast very good, I felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very good time. Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel D
Reviews.Content: Very kind and helpful staff. The room had a good space and was clean and comfortable. Nice breakfast. The location is just perfect: very close to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, and other nice places (though it's still in a quiet location)

Reviews.Title: “gret deal”
Reviews.Author: fujiko23
Reviews.Content: Raymond hotel is a small structure in the heart of Istanbul. Very welcoming and warm, helpful staff, comfortable rooms and very good food, as for breakfast as for lunch and dinner.Nothing to complain about the cleanig, very accurate. Close to the main sites of interest of the city (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, TopKapi, Spice Bazar and Grand Bazar). They have a shuttle service to the airports of Istanbul. Great deal for location, structure and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Boyan R
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel in the centre of Istanbul. Quiet street. Close to almost all seasights. Excellent service from the reception and errand boys. Thanks to all staff there.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We had for nights at this hotel arriving very late but to a warm welcome. The staff were courteous and helpful throughout our stay. The breakfast was excellent and the hotel is right in the middle of all the sights. The bedroom although rather small was spotless and the daily service excellent. Strongly recommend. DB

Reviews.Title: “Great location; serviceminded staff”
Reviews.Author: jonas_belfrage
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on the Internet and had our choice confirmed via the reviews on Trip Advisor. Very well located hotel, close to key toursi sites. The offered price per night was attarctive and decisive. Nicely refurbished hotel and rooms. We appreciated the cleanliness and bathroom/shower. Negative about our room was the slightly disturbing noice from the AC gadgets outside the window. Staff was very attentive and nice. Breakfast buffet was good, however we missed some dishes normally available in European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good service, didn't like the breakfast selection at all”
Reviews.Author: VeryFrench
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel. Our room had plenty of space, according to Istanbul standards, unlike some of the past reviews. It was cleaned religiously everyday and spotless. The bathroom was ok. The breakfast was definitely not to our taste. Really didnâ€™t like it, even the Nutella spread was not good. The fruits were not attractive and the selection of charcuterie was so pink it looked made of plastic. Another problem was the TV, which sounded promising with satellite channel. Unfortunately, we only found with the help of the manager 1 channel in French (TV24) and 1 channel in English (BBC News) !!! So it was slightly dull ! But fortunately, when in Istanbul, there are much more interesting things to do ! The location is ideal for the tourist area. The reception and managers were friendly and always ready to help !

Reviews.Title: “First Class Home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gwpyvr1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel for one month in October-September 2011. This was a return visit and as during my last stay, found everything more than satisfying. To spend a month in a property could be trying but not at the Raymond. The rooms are immaculate (I've stayed in a few). The beds and bedding are really first class. Arrived back in my room one cool day to find a lovely light down comforter on the bed. Nice touch. The staff throughout the hotel and restaurant are extremely thoughtful and helpful, Most have become friends. Many staff were there during my previous stay. Location couldn't be better. Ideally situated on a relatively quiet street (compared to most), between the Spice Market and The Blue Mosque. A 2 minute walk to the Gulhane Tram stop. This is a real treasure in Istanbul with a steady following. Melisa (Reservation Manager) goes out of her way to make sure you are content. I won't hesitate to stay at the Raymond when in return to Istanbul in 2012. Excellent in all regards. Cannot find one fault.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hklove
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor and booked directly with the hotel. Despite sending an email the week before to remind us of our visit when we arrived at the hotel we found they had overbooked! We were sent to another hotel The flower palace.We were the second couple that day to be sent over. When we eventually checked in to Raymond we were given a room on the ground floor immediately above the restaurant.room 105! We had originally requested an upper level floor.which was a pointless exercise! The room was therefore very noisy ending at 1am but starting up just before 6am when tables got laid for breakfast. We also had the reception on our floor and the lift door opened directly into our room.It felt like a bit of an insult. The hotel did apologise by paying for a meal in their restaurant.. The staff at the hotel all seemed very nice. The location of the hotel was perfect. In terms of cleanliness the bathroom was clean and the room looked clean on the surface however there were nuts under the radiator when we arrived and ware still there when we left so more attention could be paid to the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an Incredibly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located in between the major tourist sites but still had a neighborhood feel. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Free Internet was provided in the lobby and a code was given to access the wi-fi in your room. The room was nicely decorated and plenty spacious for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vikarvalho
Reviews.Content: upon arrival our room was very small, to put a baby cot they had to remove the bedside table, put the bed near the wall and fit the cot between the bed and desk so no space to use anything else in the room (desk, minibar). We complaint and they told us another room was going to be available next day. Next day we moved the the other room where we had more space but I had to convince my husband to not move to another hotel to avoid the hassle of paying cancellation fee, etc. Staff was very polite and friendly. Room was not clean properly since the first day. We were in 3 and i had to ask for a third towel all the time. Shower cabin very small, we had to squeeze to get in. Mould in the bathroom ceiling. Bedroom floor dirty. Great location, Breakfast with lots of options but not much for our taste.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect staff, perfect everything”
Reviews.Author: Nino_Kurdiani
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel from 20 to 22 of September 2011. The hotel impressed us with first view. 1) I liked the location - it is situated in 5 minute walk away from many important sightseeings: Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Archaeological Museum, Hippodrome, Basilika Cisterna, Blue Mosque... Also tram station is very near - in 100-150 meters from hotel. 2) Staff is very very pleasant and lovely. Everybody smiles and are ready for help. Especially the boy in the reception named Ramazan - special thanks to him for hospitality. 3) Interior of rooms is very lovely and tasty. 4) Rooms are so clean that everything shines. I have been in many hotels but cleanness was really striking here. 5) The hotel has good variety of tasteful breakfast. 6) Two terraces on the roof with marvelous views on the city is additional advantage. You can spend nice evenings on these terraces. Somebody wrote that "You will enjoy it, especially if you don't like large chain hotels. This one is small with a lot of Turkish warmth and personality". I agree with her (him).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: CristiGrigore
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff was exemplary. We would return to Raymond anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: faris-L2Travel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is excellent for walking to the Metro stop and you can also short walk to the Spice Bazaar. It is right in the middle of Top kapi and Hagia Sofia area and all your walk is on flat streets where you can reach your destination without needs to have half an hour rest. Comapred to other hotels we stayed at, near the sea front where you have to be experienced mountain hiker to get to where the attractions and resturnats are. The staff are the most friendly you can get in Istanbul and very helpful in directing you to the right places and take away the hassel of booking your tours. The room are clean and compact and the resturant has the very good food at prices better than you get in resturants. I was so impressed with the hotel that I would go there again next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Rezeda S
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable location. Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar are in the walk availability. Personnel is incredibly friendly! Rooms are very comfortable and clean! Tasty cuisine! I hope, we will come back again!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lreece
Reviews.Content: The Raymond Hotel is situated in a perfect place for discovering Istanbul, especially if it is your first trip. Since it is in the Sultanamet area, it is close to all the big sights. Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia are just around the corner. It is just a block away from the tram, so getting to other areas of the city is very easy. And even though it is in a busy area, the rooms are relatively quiet. Ours was on the front looking over a busy street and we weren't bothered at all by noise. The staff here is outstanding...from the front desk people to the waiters and room maids. Everyone was very helpful, cheerful, and friendly. The breakfast is delicious and their restaurant is excellent for a good dinner. The only downside for us was that no one remembered to tell us about the rooftop terrace until the last night we were there. Fortunately, we found it in time to see a glorious sunset over Istanbul. This is a great place to stay. You will enjoy it, especially if you don't like large chain hotels. This one is small with a lot of Turkish warmth and personality! I will definitely stay here again if I'm fortunate enough to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: rochdel
Reviews.Content: Really nice location in Sultanahmet with spacious, light rooms if you are facing the road side. Staff are really pleasant and this is a rather small and intimate hotel. The terrace has great views of Istanbul and Ayasofya.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, Clean, and Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: Capetownrio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raymond Hotel. The service was good any problem that arose was fixed. they try very hard. the rooms are clean and the street is safe with convenient great resturants all down the street. If you get tired and dont want to be hassled eat at anyone of the resturants on this stylist street. Staff was very nice, friendly and the room was kept clean and was tidy when I arrived. I would return next trip. Only warning is the street area late at night is possibly iffy - so dont stay out to 3:00 and use a cab if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Practical, Very Clean, Very good priced,”
Reviews.Author: Mina86
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location: 15 seconds from tram station/ 3 minute walk from blue mosque/ Aya sohpia/ topkapi palace/ and the lively Sultanahmet. If you are more a party person and want to stay in taksim it's also a good 5 minute away by cab. Very Clean room.. Breakfast was very fullfilling with alot of varieties. Compared to other hotels we checked, this was one of the best priced ones. Service was very good and were very attentive whenever we needed them. Cons: To be honest I tried thinking of something bad but couldn't find much....maybe they could add nargila to the roof top terrace. All in all excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I liked my stay at Raymound Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Majid_SA
Reviews.Content: I liked the time I spent at the hotel. It is close to the historical places in Istanbul. Also, the staff there are so freindly and helpful, especially Mr. Erdal Ã‡iftÃ§i who helped us alot and provided us with all the information we need about the city and arranged our tours. He made our stay easy and enjoyable. Thank you Mr. Erdal so much for being so helpful. I am planing to come and stay at Raymound Hotel again.. Many thanks for everyone at the hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheetahbaby
Reviews.Content: This was a well designed boutique hotel with very nice, upscale feel. Bathroom was nicely tiled with a great shower and everything just worked perfectly. The bed was ridiculously comfortable, so relaxing we had trouble getting out of bed everyday. The price was a bit higher than we could get from a small hotel closer to the water, but the feel was definitely more luxury. The breakfast spread was fantastic, something we looked forward to. The hotel also has a nice roof top terrace with great views but this under-marketed and could get a lot more attention which it deserves. Just 5 minutes awalk from Topacki palace and a 10 min walk to aya sofia, the hotel was centrally located. We were amazed that so many of our friends ended up staying at these hotels that were 20-30 minutes walk from the mosques when there were in fact so many great deals like the raymond that were much closer and more convenient. The staff were very friendly, laid back attitude, but attentive and generous as to guestsÂ´needs. We would definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: sanjayistanbul
Reviews.Content: Our first four days getting to know Istanbul was spent in Raymond Hotel. Great breakfasts in hotel restaurant included in price. Rooms had a bit of romance in the decor, tasteful. Nice rooftop for sunset drinks, views of city.

Reviews.Title: “I Recommend Raymond Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Verstegen
Reviews.Content: Great central location, close to transport where needed. Able to walk to most sightseeing areas. Staff are excellent, friendly and very helpful. Wifi free. Some rooms are maybe not spacious, however the rooms are spotless clean. Beds had a firm clean matress with clean bedlinen. Bathrooms were spotless, clean towels and good running warm water. Street noise was minimal when windows were closed. [streetnoise can be heard anywhere in busy Istanbul]. Breakfast was excellent offering plenty of choices on a daily basis. Staff in the restaurant were very friendly and offered a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: gwpyvr1
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in June 2011 and couldn't be happier. Location is perfect, a short walk between the Spice Market and Blue Mosque. Comfortable, extremely well appointed and spotlessly clean room with large bathroom. Breakfast couldn't be much better. Melisa (Reservation Manager), was there to provide any assistance one would need and the front desk staff became friends. Great people. What a friendly and welcoming atmosphere to return to after a long day of touring. Superb dining room and staff. Highly recommend and will return. Of the many hotels I've stayed at in Istanbul the Raymond rates at the top.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for a short city trip”
Reviews.Author: travellerGregory
Reviews.Content: AA lovely place with tidy comfortable rooms. Close to everywhere. Not noisy and safe to stay. Breakfast is not an impressive side of the hotel. It is good but might be better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: The Raymond just about has it all: location, tastefully decorated rooms, a pleasant roof terrace, friendly, helpful staff and at least when I stayed, rates that compared very favorably to other places close by. My bed was nice and firm, wifi is free and strong, and double glazed windows completely mask the noise of air conditioning units outside. It's located just steps from GÃ¼lhane tram stop, ideal for visiting Topkapi and the Archeology Museum, but also the Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque and everything from the Spice Bazaar to the Grand Bazaar. Galata on the other side of the Golden Horn is also easily accessible, and the ferries to go further afield are also nearby. My room had nothing in the way of a view, but I spent an afternoon in the sun on the roof and enjoyed a nightcap up there too, taking in the views over the water. The restaurant/breakfast area downstairs (reached through a dark lobby area that is functional rather than inviting) offers a nice surprise: it looks out onto a cobblestone street at the back of the hotel. My room was a tad small, but had everything I needed. Staff was great and on the couple of occasions I saw them dealing with demanding guests, their attitude was patient and professional. They use the terrace as their smoking area, but didn't bother me at all as I spent an afternoon relaxing in the sun, except to occasionally offer me tea or water. There are many hotels in Istanbul, many in fact on the same street. I can't claim to have seen them all, but I know that the next time I go back to Istanbul, I won't have to spend time looking around. I'll head straight for the Raymond.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sophie188633
Reviews.Content: The Raymond Hotel is centrally located, spotlessly clean, and offers good value-for-money. The staff were wonderful and couldn't do enough to help. When I had to leave early due to a family emergency, they were incredibly helpful and understanding. I only ended up staying two days, but would readily return in future and was impressed by the customer service shown along with the attention to detail in everything from the breakfast offerings to the cleaning of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel, staff excellent and v.good value for money”
Reviews.Author: annerogers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over F1 weekend. The hotel was in a perfect location for seeing the best that Istanbul has to offer. Hotel was great value for money, rooms not huge but spotlessly clean and bathroom modern. The 5* rating is for the staff who couldn't do enough for us, booked private (cheap) transfers to the F1 circuit and airport the following day. Wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel and will stay here again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very nice clean hotel nice staff”
Reviews.Author: FEDOUAALGERIA
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay and I will return next JUNE with all my family realy the staff is very kind and nice people ,MELISSA /MURAT/MUHEIDIN/MAHMOUD ............ They are lovely and very helpfull I seel like I'm at home also the room was very sunny and clean , changed every day also two oftens per day ,the breakfest is very rich a,d the staff also are serviable and I spent 10 days as quene and princess with my mother

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSquirell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in excelent location if you want to walk on foot to old part of Istanbul. Other districts is so easy to get by metro. The rooms were small but nice decorated and clean. But I really have to mention, that sound isolation is really bad.....but...if you are coming not for sleep, so. Brekfast is ok. The staff is really helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “A nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThanosRubis
Reviews.Content: Generally good service from the staff, some of them didn't have good sense of humor. The room was rather small but clean, recently renovated. Did not operate the heater in the bathroom. The TV had many satellite channels but was quite difficult to handle. Good wifi. There wasn't at the hotel first aid kit when I needed it after an injury. The parking of the hotel was far away, very expensive 12 euros per day and not very secure. The breakfast was good with enough variety and fresh ingredients. But the coffee was crap. The location very good close to all attractions and close to the tram. I would recommend it if you get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: AlterdoChao
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Raymond Hotel, since the first minute the staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone was attentive to our plans and requests, specially the front office staff. The Hotel was comfortable and clean, with a very good location. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped room with bad smell”
Reviews.Author: Dusin
Reviews.Content: Good things first: Great location, good breakfast, nice bathroom, comfortable bed, nice decor in rooms. Negative: Tiny, tiny room. We could not even open our suitcase on the floor, but had to put it on the bed to be able to fold it out. Also there was a kind of septic tank smell in our room the entire stay (four nights). Our friends in the floor above had the same problem. Service was not impressive.

Reviews.Title: “4* appearance in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ulrike_Christian
Reviews.Content: This Hotel couldn't be better located. Walking distance from transport, from ALL major sightseeing musts, from the golden horn. The rooms are modern with an ottoman touch, very clean and beds are really comfortable. Breakfast offers a wide choice for everyones taste. But don't expect a typicall full english...if you want that, stay home. Olives, fresh salads, cereals, boiled egss and loads more is on offer. Staff is extremly friendly and helpful. Would be my first choice on next stay.

Reviews.Title: “experience”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaSz
Reviews.Content: location was great, close to transport, shopping,history hotel staff were very helpfull,very hospitable,friendly and could not do enough to make us feel welcome and at home.Breafast was good, Room was comfortable

Reviews.Title: “A three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 99cbd
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice room but very small: 3 m per 6 m. Small bathroom, too. Good services, good, tasty food at correct prices in its restaurant, but limited number of dishes. Excellent location as it is 5 minutes by walk to Sf Sofia, 7 min to Blue Mosq and 5 min by walk to Topkapi Palace. Free WiFi connection in each room and it works fine. All in one it is a 3 star hotel by my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Excellent value and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian_bol
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay! Really well located in the heart of the old town. Everyone is really willing to help you in order to make the most of your stay in Ä°stanbul! I will for sure stay here again next time Ä° come to Ä°stanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This is a truly outstanding small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ldgaughan
Reviews.Content: This is a truly outstanding small hotel in a very convenient location. My 6-day stay was exceptionally pleasant. The hotel is clean, quiet,and well-managed, and with a very competent staff. My room was reasonably priced, and there were no hidden charges. The free breakfast was plentiful, varied, healthy, and delicious. The hotel restaurant was one of the best restaurants on my visit, and very reasonably priced. The free wi-fi worked without a hitch. When I come back to Istanbul I would not consider staying anywhere else. The metro/tram from AtatÃ¼rk Airport comes to within one block of the hotel, at a total cost of less than $3. The same would be the fare to Taksim Square. Half that fare takes you to the Grand Bazaar. There are wonderful shops within several blocks of the hotel. The front desk manager, Hacer GÃ¶nÃ¼ltaÅŸ, and the sales and reservation manager, Semra Comlek, both are excellent at their jobs. They are both quite fluent in English, but they always let me speak Turkish with them, since improving my Turkish was one of the reasons for my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Raymond for living in a dream.”
Reviews.Author: Reniuka
Reviews.Content: I and my friend stayed 9 nights in Raymond Hotel at the beggining of the November. From the beginning everything was OK. After several days we asked about better wi-fi connection in the room and they changed our room. There was too a little bit to much loud from outside in early morning from the street. But it wasn't very noisy. The rooms have very comfortable beds (not 2 pushed together), and a beautiful bathrom with a huge shower. The rooms loose one mark for wardrobe space, it's limited. Good buffet breakfast, fast Wifi throughout with communal laptops in the lobby for free. On lobby always was free sweet cakes, tee and juice for guest. The rooms are very clean, breakfast was perfect in that little hotel. Best of all in the Raymond Hotel is the staff, they are attentive, helpful, always smiling, courteous and most are able to speak english to help us get by Raymond Hotel is in a great location in the old part of Istanbul, Sultanahmet. The tramway stated 2 minutes from hotel. I really recommend it. Thanks Raymond for living in a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, brilliant staff.”
Reviews.Author: PEJABE
Reviews.Content: Raymond Hotel is in a great location in the old part of Istanbul, Sultanahmet. A short walk to all the main tourist sights, 60mtrs to a tram stop and another short walk to a main ferry terminal make it easy to get about. The facilities are good, restaurant, bar, wi-fi, computers and the rooms are good value. The rooms loose one mark for wardrobe space, it's limited. Around the hotel are a multitude of restaurants and bars for all tastes, try Faros, they're brilliant (Lamb Casserole is a great dish). Best of all in the Raymond Hotel is the staff, they are attentive, helpful, always smiling, courteous and most are able to speak english to help us get by. They made our stay in the hotel and Istanbul a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in the hearth of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aston79
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel last august for one week. when i booked the hotel was just opened and on tripadvisor there were only few reviews, even they were good. i stayed in room 402 which was quite large (probably is the one used for website photos...) the window view was good as it faced out the main street and a large park placed in front of the hotel. everything was new and room was totally cleaned everyday. bed was very confortable. staff was very friendly expecially the wonderful receptionist and the guy who help with with luggage and elevator. breakfast is good. only orange juice is a little disappointing... the location is marvellous. tram stop is near the hotel but you can't hear tram noise from your room. two years ago i stayed in a 4 star design hotel in beyoglu and in was very disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT WITH EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: efe_stanbul
Reviews.Content: The location was really perfect you can reach very easily to all main touristic places like Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque.. The hotel is very clean, in the room you can find all details which make you very comfortable. personel were wonderful and make you feel like you are in your home. Thank you to all Raymond Hotel team...

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT RAYMOND HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ata_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed and of the September in Raymond Hotel. From the beginning everything was perfect. Personel were always ready to help for everything .The rooms are very clean, breakfast was perfect in that little hotel, almost same with most of five star hotel. I wish to stay there longer and Ä± recommend to everyone to go there.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: kathy_moulton
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we booked Raymond Hotel in the Sultanahmet area in Istanbul. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with friendly service by all the staff. Although the room was not big it was very clean and looked newly renovated with all modern amenities.The location is very close to all transport and tourist attractions and we walked everywhere. It has a lift which is unusual fo a small hotel. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, handy location”
Reviews.Author: jzantuck
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very helpful. On arrival, they took the time to show us all the main places of interest on a map - and explained how to get there. The hotel is within easy walking distance of most of the popular sights in Sultanahmet. There is also a tram stop at the bottom of the street, if you don't feel like walking. The hotel is modern and comfortable and the breakfast provided is pretty good. A very pleasant, reasonably priced place from which to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly091
Reviews.Content: good located, near main attractions, easy to reach from the airport via metro and tram. Clean rooms, good breakfast. not everybody from the reception knows English and not everybody is willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: joeinasia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Raymond for five nights and ended up extended my stay an additional three nights. The hotel, the STAFF, the food was all AMAZING. The location is great and is centrally located. Anyone who has an appreciation for design and style, should stay here and the for the price and quality there is nothing comparable. Istanbul is amazing city and I see my self coming back ---and the The Raymond will always be my first choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Raymond Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ebussuut Caddesi No:22 Sirkeci | Old City Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
